Before getting too far into an answer, I have a couple more questions...

Is it true that server end of this sequence is what you're trying to 
test?

In particular your concerned with clients disappearing somewhere 
between database.connect() and database.disconnect()?

Is DatabaseClient an interface? Or is it a concrete class?

For what its worth, I'm already leaning towards mock-objects. Are you 
familiar w/ them?

-- Levi

> DatabaseInterface database = (DatabaseInterface) 
> Naming.lookup(databaseServiceName);
> if (! database.connect(this)) {
>     System.out.println("The server is busy, please try again.");
>     System.exit(1);
> }
> database.lock(1, this); // Locks record number 1
> Record record = database.getRecord(1);
> /*
>     Here, extracts and modify some field values of record 1, and 
> creates a
> new record based on the change ...
> */
> database.modify(newRecord); // Record 1 is now updated
> database.unlock(1, this);
> database.disconnect(this);      // The client has finished
